page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable setback encroachments summary

Feature
Allowable encroachment
Code Sec
Illustration
Main dwelling
• 1st floor portion at rear of structure ≤
half width of structure
to within 14' of rear lot line
18.12.050 (a)(2)
Fig 18 on this
page
• 1st floor extension of an existing front
setback encroachment
to within 14' of front lot line

Fig 19 p. 25

side setback encroachment
to within 5' of interior-side
lot line

Fig 19 p. 25

side setback encroachment
to within 10' of street-side
lot line
18.12.050 (a)(1)(C)
Fig 19 p. 25
• Attached storage closets ≤ 6' in height
& ≤ 25 sf
4' into front & rear yards & 2' into
side yards
Detached accessory structures
• that are 75' from front lot line and 20'
from street-side lot line
in rear or side yards

Fig 34 p. 39

95' deep and 25' from street-side lot line
and in rear half of lot
in rear or side yards
Porches and entry features
• 1st floor balconies, uncovered porches, ,
stairways, and fire escapes
6' into front & rear yard &
3' into the side yards
18.12.050 (a)(3)(D)
• 1st floor only canopies & patio covers
rear or side yards
18.12.050 (a)(3)(E)
Other
• Eaves & cornices
2' into side & 4' into front &
rear yards
18.12.050 (a)(3)(A)
• 1st floor bay / greenhouse windows
composed of a window surface &
cantilevered with no floor joists.
2' into front yard &
3' into rear yard
18.12.050 (a)(3)(B)
• Greenhouse windows only
2' into side yards
• Uncovered parking
in rear or side yards except for
1st 10' of street side yard
to within 6' of rear & interior-side
lot lines
18.12.060 (.c)
Fig 34 p. 39
• Pools & spas (not equipment)
2' into side yard
• Fireplaces ≤ 5' wide
Excavated features
• Lightwells and stairwells
3' into side yards & 4' into rear yard
(cumulative length ≤ 15')
18.12.090 (c)
Fig 39 p. 42
• Below grade patios
2' into side yards & 4' into rear yard
(cumulative length ≤ 5')
Fig 40 p. 43

Allowable rear
encroachment
Fig 18 Allowable encroachment: rear yard

Rear yard encroachment
A portion of the main dwelling (no wider than half the max.
width of the dwelling), may encroach into the rear setback, at the
ground floor only, as follows:
• For all lots except back-to-back corner lots, up to 6', provid-
ing a minimum setback of 14' is maintained.
• For back-to-back corner lots, up to 10', providing a minimum
setbackof 10' is maintained.

Note:
• Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be con-
tiguous with existing protrusion.
• Only for legally constructed structures (no variance or an
home-improvement exception (HIE)).
• Only once in the life of the structure.

Setback that is
to be main-
tained per
notes above
Allowable
rear yard
encroachment
per notes
above

24

visual_elements.description: A table summarizing allowable setback encroachments. It has four columns: 'Feature', 'Allowable encroachment', 'Code Sec', and 'Illustration'. The table is divided into sections: 'Main dwelling', 'Detached accessory structures', 'Porches and entry features', 'Other', and 'Excavated features'. Each section lists specific features with their corresponding encroachment rules, code sections, and references to illustrations.
visual_elements.location: Left and middle sections of the page

visual_elements.description: A plan view diagram illustrating allowable rear yard encroachment. It shows a 'New OR Existing main dwelling' in a light grey rectangular area. A darker grey rectangular area labeled '1st story Addition' is shown encroaching into the 'Rear yard'. The addition is shown to be 'Half width of building max'. Dashed lines indicate the 'Interior-side yard' on both sides and the 'Front yard' at the bottom. Text labels point to the 'Rear yard', 'Setback that is to be maintained per notes above', and 'Allowable rear yard encroachment per notes above'. The 'Buildable area' is also indicated.

additional_notes: Page number '24' is present at the bottom left corner.
The text '1st floor portion at rear of structure S half width of structure' has a 'S' symbol which might be a '≤' (less than or equal to) symbol, but due to image quality, it's not perfectly clear.
The text '1st floor balconies, uncovered porches,, stairways, and fire escapes' has a double comma which might be a typo or an artifact from photocopying.
The text 'Fireplaces ≤ 5 wide' is missing a unit, likely 'feet'.
